db:abstract.db:para: The Qt QML module defines and implements the QML language.

db:article.db:para: The Qt QML module provides a framework for developing applications and libraries with the QML language. It defines and implements the language and engine infrastructure, and provides an API to enable application developers to extend the QML language with custom types and integrate QML code with JavaScript and C++. The Qt QML module provides both a QML API and a C++ API.

Note that while the Qt QML module provides the language and infrastructure for QML applications, the Qt Quick module provides many visual components, model-view support, an animation framework, and much more for building user interfaces.
For those new to QML and Qt Quick, please see QML Applications for an introduction to writing QML applications.

db:section.db:title: C++ API
db:section.db:para: Using the C++ API requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module components in the Qt6 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt6 COMPONENTS Qml REQUIRED) target_link_libraries(mytarget PRIVATE Qt6::Qml)
db:section.db:para: See also the Build with CMake overview.
